Design for a Fountain in a Park

label: Description
value: A circular bowl stands in the center of an oblong basin. A fountain springs in its center, and water pours into it from the mouths of two satyr masks at the top of the hermae. These stand upon dados, from which water pours into the basin at several places. Groups of trees are behind the fountain, permitting, in the middle, a view into the open country. Black framing line.

Water color; On the shore in Chiaja

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Three men move a boat lying on the shore, at left. At right are a standing and spinning woman, a seated woman nursing a baby with a girl standing beside her, three men and an eating child. At left is a rock, at right is a promontory with structure, in the background are Capri and the peninsula of Sorrento. Framing line. The signature is in the lower right corner: "Gatta f. 1828."

label: Credit line

Project for the Tomb of the Maréchal de Belle-Isle

label: Description
value: In this monumental scheme, the Maréchal's former wife and son (each of whom had predeceased him),  flank the standing Maréchal, dressed in classical armor. The Maréchal gestures towards his wife, who stoops to greet him at the doorway (surmounted by family crest and pair of lions) of  the family mausoleum; his son (also in classical military garb) kneels and kisses his father's left hand.  The angel of death, holding a scythe, hovers above.  Smoke emanates from censors on either side of the central group.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk, pen and black ink, point of brush and brown-black ink; gray and brown wash, red watercolor, white gouache on yellow-brown wove paper

label: Provenance
value: Possibly Prunelé, Comte Andre-Gaspard-Parfait de Bizemont, Paris [1]; 24 May 1876: Alfred Hubert (sale, Paris); 1878: E.H.R. (possibly Edouard Rodigues, sale, Paris); 8 May 1894: Juan Jorges Peoli (Lugt 2020; sale, New York, no. 473); Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum               [1] Note: Possibly from the collection of Prunelé, Comte André-Gaspard-Parfait de Bizemont, but reference in Benisovich may have been misunderstood.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
